DataElement.preferredName: Electrocardiographic Finding QTcF Assessment Result Time in Millisecond Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A formula-based value which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcF = QT/CubeRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Graphic representation and categorization of the electrical vectors produced by the depolarization and repolarization of myocardial tissue.__A formula which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcF = QT/CubeRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second. (NCI)__The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Electrocardiographic Finding QTcF - Fridericia's Correction Formula
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Graphic representation and categorization of the electrical vectors produced by the depolarization and repolarization of myocardial tissue.:A formula which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcF = QT/CubeRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second.

Concepts.definition: Graphic representation and categorization of the electrical vectors produced by the depolarization and repolarization of myocardial tissue.

A formula which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcF = QT/CubeRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second.

Property.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent millisecond(s) passage of time._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:A unit of time, which is equal to one thousandth of a second.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR clinical trial
